titleStmt.title: Lady Pecunia, or The praise of money Also a combat betwixt conscience and couetousnesse. Togither with, the complaint of poetry, for the death of liberality. Newly corrected and inlarged, by Richard Barnfield, graduate in Oxford.
Encomion of Lady Pecunia
titleStmt.author: Barnfield, Richard, 1574-1627.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W[illiam] I[aggard] and are to bee sold by Iohn Hodgets dwelling in Paules Churchyard a little beneath Paules Schoole,

notesStmt.note: A new edition of "The encomion of Lady Pecunia" (1598), with "Poems: in divers humors" omitted.
Last leaf contains "A remembrance of some English poets".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: Paules Churchyard a little beneath Paules Schoole
